author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: A Peruvian court ordered the release of ex-President Martin Vizcarra, who was serving five months of pre-trial detention on graft allegations.
title: Former Peruvian President Vizcarra Is Ordered Released From Jail

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves says growth is the solution to Britain’s economic problems. At her budget on Nov. 26, she faces the prospect of having to kill it.
title: Rachel Reeves’ Damage Control Budget Raises UK Growth Fears

author: Philip Aldrick
description: The UK could raise £1.9 billion ($2.6 billion) a year from lawyers, accountants and financiers by removing an outdated relief for business partnerships, according to a proposal that could help Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves as she seeks to fill a black hole in the public finances.
title: UK Partnership Tax Could Give Reeves £1.9 Billion, Study Says

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump said former ally Elon Musk has no choice but to return to the Republican Party after their highly public rift earlier this year.
title: Trump Says Musk Has ‘Problems’ But Sees Him Returning to GOP

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney invited one of the architects of Project 2025 to speak to his cabinet as the government tries to strike a trade deal with US President Donald Trump.
title: Project 2025 Author to Give Carney’s Cabinet a Briefing on Trump

author: Andreina Itriago, Eric Martin
description: US President Donald Trump is escalating his “maximum pressure” campaign against the socialist government of Venezuela with the deployment of warships, aircraft and troops to the southern Caribbean. On Sep. 2, as part of this campaign to counter Latin American drug cartel activity, US forces struck a purported drug trafficking vessel coming from Venezuela. According to Trump, the strike killed 11 “terrorists” on board.
title: Why Trump Is Deploying US Warships Near Venezuela

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Capitol influence reporter Jamie Tarabay looks at the effort to release the Jeffrey Epstein files. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Furor Over Epstein Files Grows as Trump Dismisses ‘Hoax’

author: Steven T. Dennis, Erik Wasson
description: Republicans are planning to upend Senate rules to confirm Donald Trump’s stalled nominees in one vote, speeding up the president’s ability to fill top regulatory, district court and other posts and essentially neutering Democratic dissent.
title: Senate Republicans Hatch Plan to Speed Up Trump’s Stalled Nominees

author: Nacha Cattan, Laura Nahmias
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams, struggling in his bid for reelection, denied that he received an offer from the Trump Administration to work at the US Department of Housing and Urban Development.
title: Eric Adams Denies He’s Been Offered Job in Trump Administration

author: David Voreacos
description: Harvard University scored a major legal victory in its battle with the Trump administration after a court ruled that the US illegally froze more than $2 billion in research funding.
title: Harvard $2 Billion Funding Freeze Found Illegal by US Judge

author: Felipe Marques
description: Billionaire developer Rick Caruso said he is “seriously looking” at running for either California governor or mayor of Los Angeles next year.
title: Billionaire Caruso ‘Seriously’ Looking at Running for Mayor or Governor

author: Piotr Skolimowski, Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland’s new president got just what he came to Washington for — a commitment from Donald Trump that the US won’t pull troops from his country and could even increase their presence.
title: Trump Vows to Shield Poland in Any Troop Withdrawal From Europe

author: Maya Averbuch, Eric Martin
description: Mexico and the US agreed to increase cooperation to combat criminal organizations involved in the international drug trade, a key demand from President Donald Trump for the Latin American nation.
title: Mexico, US Agree to More Cooperation in Fight Against Cartels

description: Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey is urging Trump to stop the government’s moves to halt offshore wind developments, calling attention to the already-high cost of energy for consumers. Healey spoke with Bloomberg's Caroline Gage. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Mass. Gov. Healey: Trump Taking Away Power by Dismantling Wind Projects

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: President Donald Trump’s latest budget cuts are piling financial pressures on the United Nations and its struggling peacekeeping missions.
title: Trump’s Rescission Cuts Threaten UN Peacekeeping Operations

author: Greg Ryan, Sri Taylor
description: Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey said a halt to federal research funding is threatening the state’s knowledge-based economy, warning that the cuts will undermine jobs and the highly educated workforce.
title: Massachusetts Governor Warns of Economic Hit From Trump Cuts

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canadian Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre demanded the government abolish the country’s temporary foreign worker program, arguing that it allows employers to import low-wage labor at the expense of young Canadians.
title: Carney’s Conservative Rival Targets Foreign Workers in Clash Over Jobs

author: Manuela Tobias, Eric Martin
description: The US paused Argentina’s bid for a visa waiver just as the process for its entry into the program was getting underway, in a fresh setback for President Javier Milei ahead of a crucial midterm vote on Sunday.
title: US Taps Brakes on Argentina Visa Waiver in Another Setback for Milei

author: Daniel Cancel
description: Florida is taking steps to end all vaccine mandates in the state, the surgeon general announced at an event with Governor Ron DeSantis.
title: Florida Surgeon General Vows to End ‘Every Last’ Vaccine Mandate

author: Jordan Fabian
description: President Donald Trump insinuated trade agreements with economies including the European Union, Japan and South Korea would be axed if his global tariffs are ultimately ruled illegal by the US court system.
title: Trump Suggests Trade Deals Would End If Tariffs Are Struck Down

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump indicated his next deployment of federal troops could be to New Orleans at the behest of Republican Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry, as local leaders in Chicago continue to decry his pledge to send the National Guard to their city.
title: Trump Eyes Deploying Forces on Friendlier Turf in New Orleans

author: Chris Strohm, Maeve Sheehey
description: Republican Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene said she’s willing to go on the House floor and identify the rich and powerful people who abused underage girls as part of Jeffrey Epstein’s sex-trafficking ring.
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Threatens to Reveal Epstein Abusers. Here’s How She Could Do It

author: Zoe Schneeweiss, William Horobin
description: Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau joined a chorus of global policymakers sounding the alarm over White House attacks on the Federal Reserve.
title: ECB’s Villeroy Blasts ‘Serious Regressions’ of Trump Fed Attacks

author: Zoe Tillman
description: President Donald Trump says he will ask the US Supreme Court to reverse a $5 million sexual abuse and defamation judgment against him in New York writer E. Jean Carroll’s civil lawsuit.
title: Trump Will Ask Supreme Court to Toss Carroll Sex-Abuse Verdict

author: Thomas Seal
description: Mark Carney said Canada and the US are in negotiations to resolve issues in tariff-hit sectors after a “very constructive” conversation with President Donald Trump on Monday evening.
title: Carney Sends Envoys to DC After ‘Very Constructive’ Trump Call

author: Lucy White
description: Reform Party Leader Nigel Farage compared the UK to North Korea as he used testimony to a US congressional hearing to brand arrests made in Britain under online safety laws a threat to free speech.
title: Nigel Farage Likens UK to North Korea Taking Online Speech Fight to US

author: Agnieszka Barteczko, Skylar Woodhouse
description: US President Donald Trump said the US could increase its troop presence in Poland and indicated more financial penalties targeting Moscow could be implemented based on the results of an upcoming conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump Says He’s Open to More US Troops in Poland and Russia Penalties

author: Alicia Diaz
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson signaled the Republican party plans to hold a national convention ahead of next year’s midterm congressional elections, noting that he recently spoke to President Donald Trump about the matter and considers it “a done deal.”
title: Speaker Johnson Considers National GOP Convention a ‘Done Deal’

author: Aaron Eglitis
description: Latvia’s defense minister said his country should start drafting women into the military in 2028 as part of an effort to expand the size of its armed forces.
title: Latvia Floats Plan to Draft Women From 2028 in Military Buildup

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin praised US envoy Steve Witkoff’s role in negotiations on the war in Ukraine, saying he accurately reported the Kremlin’s viewpoint to Donald Trump following meetings.
title: Putin Defends Witkoff’s Role in Conveying Russian Views to Trump

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Conservative politician Anutin Charnvirakul is poised to become Thailand’s next prime minister via a lower house vote, having secured the backing of the largest party in parliament and fended off last-ditch efforts by a rival group to force a snap election.
title: Decks Clear for Conservative Politician Anutin to Become Thailand’s New Premier

author: Jamie Tarabay, Chris Strohm, Jimmy Jenkins
description: Survivors of deceased financier Jeffrey Epstein’s sex trafficking ring called on Congress to pass legislation requiring the Trump administration to release all unclassified material gathered in a federal investigation of the operation, including information on clients who abused underage girls.
title: Survivors of Epstein Abuse Call for Release of Secret Files

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran’s ban on international nuclear inspections has led to a critical loss of knowledge about the country’s atomic work, United Nations monitors wrote in two restricted reports, their first since the Israeli and US attacks on the Islamic Republic in June.
title: UN Inspectors Warn of Lost Knowledge Over Iran Nuclear Work

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Business is brisk for Washington whisperer Michael Bopp, whose specialty preparing besieged CEOs for congressional testimony is in high demand as President Donald Trump and fellow Republicans take aim at public media, universities and major corporations.
title: Meet the Lawyer CEOs Call When They’re Summoned to Capitol Hill

author: Annie Massa
description: American Bitcoin Corp., a crypto company created this year with President Donald Trump’s two eldest sons, surged in initial trading on Wednesday, after a roundabout series of transactions lifted it on to public markets. The deal paved the way for Eric Trump and Donald Trump Jr., both of whom hold stakes in the Bitcoin miner, to profit anew from crypto’s mainstream embrace under their father’s administration.
title: Trumps Cash In on Crypto Anew as American Bitcoin Shares Surge

author: Alicia Diaz
description: A Republican senator closely allied with President Donald Trump said he will urge the US administration to restrict visas for the executives of the Norwegian sovereign wealth fund after it divested its holdings of heavy-equipment maker Caterpillar Inc.
title: Trump Ally Says Will Seek Norway Visa Denials Over Caterpillar

author: Olesia Safronova, Sara Sjolin
description: Military equipment maker Fire Point plans to open a facility in Denmark, becoming the first Ukrainian defense company to start production in a Nordic country following a governmental agreement reached in June, the Danish Defense Ministry said.
title: Ukraine to Open Facility Producing Rocket Fuel in Denmark

author: Courtney McBride
description: The US military’s “precision” attack on a purported Venezuelan drug trafficking vessel in the Caribbean could be just the start, according to Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.
title: Hegseth Signals More to Come After US Strike in Caribbean

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: A blistering new assessment of the F-35 stealth-fighter program said the Pentagon is rewarding Lockheed Martin Corp. with on-time payment bonuses even when it delivers planes as much as two months late, and with many of the delivered jets beset by flaws that could take years to fix.
title: F-35 Continues to Over-Promise, Under-Deliver, GAO Says In New Review

author: Sam Dagher
description: The United Arab Emirates warned Israel that annexation of Palestinian territory in the West Bank would constitute a “red line” and “severely undermine” the regional vision for peace and integration underlying the US-brokered Abraham Accords.
title: UAE Warns Israel Annexing West Bank Would Be Deemed ‘Red Line’

author: Alisa Odenheimer
description: Israel’s Shin Bet said it foiled a Hamas plot to assassinate Itamar Ben Gvir, the country’s far-right security minister, through a drone attack.
title: Israel Says It Foils Hamas Drone Plot to Assassinate Far-Right Minister Itamar Ben Gvir

author: Dan Williams, Ethan Bronner
description: Israel is stepping up efforts to take over Gaza City this month, calling up tens of thousands of army reservists and planning to order 1 million Palestinians from their homes, despite widespread global opposition.
title: Israel Gears Up for Gaza City Takeover Despite Global Opposition

author: Daniel Carvalho, Eric Martin, Martha Viotti Beck
description: Six months ago, Eduardo Bolsonaro took leave from Brazil’s Congress and moved to the US with a clear goal: Convince Donald Trump to help save his father, former President Jair Bolsonaro, from prison.
title: Bolsonaro’s Coup Trial Speeds Ahead as His Son Fights to Keep Trump Engaged

author: Erik Larson
description: A federal appeals court blocked the Trump Administration from deporting a group of Venezuelan men under a two-century old law.
title: Trump’s Use of 1798 Law to Deport Venezuelans Blocked by Court

author: Jim Wyss
description: As Prime Minister Andrew Holness seeks a rare third term in Jamaica, he can point to falling debt, collapsing crime rates and record low unemployment. It might not be enough.
title: Jamaica Goes to the Polls as PM Who Led Turnaround Seeks Third Term

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner admitted she underpaid taxes on a property purchase and said she was referring herself to the government’s standards watchdog, the latest blow for Keir Starmer’s Labour administration that could have long-standing consequences for the party’s leadership.
title: UK Deputy Premier Rayner Admits Underpaying Tax on New Home

author: Misha Savic, Jasmina Kuzmanovic, Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Montenegro is lobbying all leaders in the European Union to allow the Balkan nation to join the world’s largest trading bloc and officially adopt the euro at the same time by 2028.
title: Montenegro’s Unorthodox Pitch: Join EU and Adopt Euro in 2028

author: Arne Delfs, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul said he’s hopeful a long-stalled free-trade accord between the European Union and India can be concluded as soon as the autumn of this year.
title: Germany Wants EU-India Trade Deal Concluded by Fall This Year

author: Jasmina Kuzmanovic, Misha Savic, Andrea Dudik
description: Montenegro’s president needs no persuading about the virtues of an independent central bank. The former economist at the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development personally picked Governor Irena Radovic and is urging her “to withstand the pressure, to fight.”
title: Montenegro’s President Tells Central Bank Chief to Fight Critics

author: Alan Wong
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping commented on the possibility of people living to 150 during a hot-mic moment with his Russian and North Korean counterparts, a rare glimpse of an unscripted chat between three of the world’s most prominent strongmen.
title: Xi Muses on Living to 150 in Rare Hot-Mic Moment With Putin, Kim

description: Washington put a $50 million bounty on Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro’s head.
title: Trump’s Gunboat Diplomacy Takes Aim at Maduro

author: John Liu
description: When Lieutenant General Han Shengyan, commander of the Central Theater Command’s Air Force, invited Chinese President Xi Jinping to inspect the troops at the parade Wednesday, military watchers took note. The job usually falls to the Central Theater Commander, a full general.
title: China Parade No-Shows Fan Speculation of Widening Military Purge

author: Peter Waldman
description: Runoff from fields and feedlots fills Iowa’s waterways with dangerous nitrates. It would be fixable if not for the political and economic power of Big Ag.
title: Why Iowa Chooses Not to Clean Up Its Polluted Water

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: President Donald Trump’s campaign to reshape the Federal Reserve gains ground on Thursday with an accelerated Senate confirmation hearing on his nomination of a close adviser to be a governor of the central bank.
title: Trump’s Drive to Reshape the Fed Progresses With Rapid Senate Hearing

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: The Italian government has ruled out using NATO funds for the construction of a €13.5 billion ($15.7 billion) bridge, ending months-long speculation about whether the project to link the mainland to Sicily would count as military expenditure.
title: Italy Rules Out Using NATO Funds to Build Messina Strait Bridge

author: Francine Lacqua, Ott Ummelas
description: Norway decided to pick the UK as the supplier of its new navy frigates as the Nordic NATO member seeks to deter Russian submarines in the High North, according to the country’s defense minister.
title: Norway Frigate Deal Focuses on Russian Subs, Defense Chief Says

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s main opposition party has called for protests in Istanbul on Wednesday, after a surprise court ruling against the party escalated fears about the country’s democratic rule and wiped out $9.2 billion from the stock market in the previous session.
title: Turkish Opposition Calls Protests After Ruling Spooks Markets

author: Grace Sihombing
description: Persistent, widespread unrest in Indonesia may undermine its sovereign credit standing through weaker economic growth and strained finances, according to Fitch Ratings Inc.
title: Fitch Says Severe Unrest May Weigh on Indonesia’s Credit Profile

author: Tara Patel
description: French plans to get tougher on tax fraud and over-optimization by the wealthy and will scrutinize more closely their holding companies and fortunes, Budget Minister Amelie de Montchalin said.
title: France to Crack Down on Rich Tax Dodgers, Budget Minister Says

author: John Liu, Jing Li, Colum Murphy
description: Russia’s Vladimir Putin and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un headlined a thinner roster of nations that turned up for President Xi Jinping’s military parade, in a new snapshot of a bloc coalescing around China.
title: Xi’s Guest List Is Shorter, More Authoritarian Than a Decade Ago

author: Alan Katz
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said he remains open to alternative budget proposals as long as the overall deficit-reduction target remains in place.
title: French PM Bayrou Open to Alternative Budget Plan If Deficit Target Remains

author: Sakura Murakami, Mari Kiyohara
description: Embattled Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba failed to quell calls for his resignation after a ruling party finalized a report on its recent election setback, leaving his fate with 150 or so lawmakers and regional representatives currently undecided on whether to effectively support his ousting.
title: Japan’s PM Ishiba Backed Into Corner Ahead of Party Vote

author: Jorge Valero, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union will publish the final text of its free-trade agreement with the South American economies of the Mercosur bloc Wednesday as it races to seal trade deals with like-minded partners in the face of renewed tensions with the US.
title: EU Pushes Ahead to Ratify Trade Deal With South American Nations

author: Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is expected to announce plans to release the UK’s annual budget on Nov. 26, according to people familiar with the matter, an event looking increasing critical for Keir Starmer’s struggling Labour administration.
title: Reeves Expected to Set Crunch UK Budget Date for Late November

author: Sotiris Nikas
description: The Greek government is poised to unveil new relief measures for the country’s ailing middle class after a fiscal turnaround that was barely conceivable during Europe’s sovereign debt crisis.
title: Greek Premier Eyes Tax Relief to Ease Years of Post-Crisis Pain

description: Europe's response to the conflict in Gaza has been a "failure" and risks undermining its global credibility, according to Spain's prime minister.
title: Europe's Gaza Response Has Been a 'Failure', Says Spanish PM

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Akemi Terukina
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba met with Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda to exchange views on the economy and financial markets including currencies, after the yen weakened amid rising pressure on Ishiba to resign.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Meets With BOJ’s Ueda to Discuss Economy, Markets

author: Agnieszka Barteczko, Maxim Edwards
description: The threat of increasing political paralysis in Warsaw comes at a bad time for Europe.
title: Trump Meeting Exposes the Political Rift Damaging Poland

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un’s teenage daughter made her international debut in China this week, with her unprecedented appearance abroad intensifying speculation she is being groomed as his eventual successor.
title: Kim Jong Un Brings Daughter as Potential Successor on China Trip

author: Hyonhee Shin, Denny Thomas
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un’s presence amid the pomp of Beijing’s military parade marks another milestone in his transformation from isolated pariah to a global player benefiting from strengthened ties with his allies.
title: Kim Jong Un Shifts Image to Global Player From Isolated Pariah

author: Stephen Stapczynski, Kathy Chen
description: On his first day in office, President Donald Trump vowed he would establish US energy dominance over the globe. Seven months on, that goal is under threat as the world’s largest importer flexes its economic and geopolitical muscle.
title: Putin’s Energy Wins in China Deal a Blow to Trump’s Export Push

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s caretaker leader, Phumtham Wechayachai, has moved to dissolve parliament, potentially paving the way for an early general election, an effort to block a bid by a rival group to form a new government after Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra was ousted.
title: Thai Acting PM Seeks to Dissolve Parliament as New Race Heats Up

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s largest political party said it will back conservative politician Anutin Charnvirakul’s bid to form a government following last week’s sacking of Paetongtarn Shinawatra as prime minister for ethics violations.
title: Largest Thai Party Backs Anutin as PM to End Political Deadlock

author: Colum Murphy
description: Donald Trump said China doesn’t pose a military threat to America and dismissed the notion that a massive military parade taking place in Beijing was a concern to the US.
title: Trump Dismisses Concern About Xi Challenging US Military Might
Xi Set to Host Putin, Kim at China Military Parade
